para_original_question.original_question: how long does eq bank hold my funds for
para_original_question.question: How long does the bank eq keep my funds for
para_original_question.answer: generally we hold funds deposited by cheque or electronic funds transfer eft for five business days beginning after the date of deposit. this means that funds held will actually become available by the sixth business day when you include the date of deposit. for example if you make a deposit on a monday you can access the funds on the following tuesday. although the deposit is reflected immediately in your account balance you won t be able to withdraw or transfer your funds until the hold period has passed. however during the hold period you still earn interest on the deposit amount. for more details check out our hold funds policy.

para_original_question.original_question: who is eq bank
para_original_question.question: which is eq bank
para_original_question.answer: eq bank offers canadians a digital banking experience. we launched officially in january 2016 with a commitment to help canadians get the most out of their money. based in toronto eq bank is a trademark of equitable bank. equitable bank is a federally regulated schedule i bank with over 900 employees across canada. dollars

para_original_question.original_question: who is equitable bank
para_original_question.question: which is a fair bank
para_original_question.answer: equitable bank canada s challenger banktm is the country s ninth largest independent schedule i bank. eq bank is the digital arm of equitable bank. you can learn more by visiting www.equitablebank.ca. dollars

para_original_question.original_question: how does eq bank make money
para_original_question.question: How does the bank eq make money
para_original_question.answer: good question banks typically make money by accepting deposits from customers and then providing loans to other customers and earning interest from those loans. we use the deposits from eq bank to furnish equitable bank s residential and commercial loans and earn interest. as a branchless bank we re able to reduce our operating costs and pass on those savings to you in the form of a great everyday interest rate on the savings plus account.

para_original_question.original_question: is eq bank hiring i want to come work for you
para_original_question.question: I want to come work for you.
para_original_question.answer: we re always looking for good people check out our latest job postings.

para_original_question.original_question: how do i open an eq bank account
para_original_question.question: How to open a bank account eq
para_original_question.answer: it s really easy you can open an account by visiting www.eqbank.ca and applying online.

para_original_question.original_question: who can open an eq bank account
para_original_question.question: which can open a bank account eq
para_original_question.answer: all eq bank customers must be a canadian resident meet their province s age of majority 18 or 19 years old depending on where you live have a social insurance number please note eq bank is not available in quebec.

para_original_question.original_question: does eq bank pull my credit report when i open an account
para_original_question.question: Bank eq pulls my credit report when I open an account
para_original_question.answer: as part of our online identity verification process we do a soft credit check meaning your credit score won t be affected and won t be visible to other third parties who view your credit report.

para_original_question.original_question: why do i need to provide my social insurance number sin when opening an account
para_original_question.question: Why do I have to provide my sin social insurance number when opening an account
para_original_question.answer: the income tax act requires all banks to obtain your social insurance number when you open an account that earns interest this includes the savings plus account and gics . banks are required to report the interest you earn each year to the canada revenue agency.

para_original_question.original_question: does eq bank support mint
para_original_question.question: done eq bank support menth
para_original_question.answer: we don t officially support access to your savings plus account through mint.

para_original_question.original_question: does eq bank offer business accounts
para_original_question.question: eq bank offers business accounts
para_original_question.answer: unfortunately we do not currently offer business accounts. the savings plus account is for personal use only. dollars

para_original_question.original_question: why is eq bank asking me to verify my identity through canada post
para_original_question.question: why eq bank asks me to verify my identity through post canada
para_original_question.answer: if we re unable to verify your identity through transunion a credit reporting agency you can do so by visiting canada post. similar to showing your government issued photo id at a bank branch we ve partnered with canada post to make verifying your identity as quick and convenient as possible. find the participating canada post outlet that s closest to you.

para_original_question.original_question: what do i need to bring with me to canada post
para_original_question.question: what should I bring with me to Canada post
para_original_question.answer: you ll need to bring 1 piece of government issued photo id 1 proof of address document if your photo id doesn t have your current address your canada post dss number see what is my canada post dss number and why is it important? dollars

para_original_question.original_question: what types of photo id are accepted by canada post
para_original_question.question: what types of id photos are accepted by canada post
para_original_question.answer: canada post will validate your identity based on the information you provided for your eq bank account application. your government issued photo id cannot be expired and the first and last name address and birthdate must be an exact match to the information you provided to us. you ll need to show one of the following pieces of government issued photo id canadian driver s license provincial or territorial photo id card canadian secure certificate of indian status canadian passport canadian permanent resident card

para_original_question.original_question: what proof of address documents do i need to bring to canada post
para_original_question.question: what proof of address the documents I need to bring to Canada post
para_original_question.answer: if your government issued photo id doesn t list your current address you ll also need to show a proof of address document such as recent utility bill residential telephone cable tv public utilities commission hydro gas or water residential lease residential mortgage statement or agreement rental agreement lease agreement of purchase and sale school college or university report card or transcript municipal tax notice canada child tax benefit statement most recent income tax assessment government cheque or government cheque stub with individual s name and address statement of employment insurance benefits paid t4e canada pension plan statement of contributions quebec pension plan statement of participation statement of benefits from provincial workplace safety or insurance board statement of direct deposit for provincial works or provincial disability support program attestation of residence issued by the responsible authorities shelters soup kitchens student senior residence long term care facilities aboriginal reserves work camps statement of old age security t4a or statement of canada pension plan benefits t4ap

para_original_question.original_question: what is my canada post dss number and why is it important
para_original_question.question: what is my post canada dss number and why is it important

para_original_question.original_question: is there an <em>interac< em> e transfer<sup>®< sup> dollar limit on sending or receiving
para_original_question.question: Is there a limit <em>interac<em> e transfer<sup>®<sup> dollar on sending or receiving
para_original_question.answer: from your eq bank account you can send up to $3 000 per day up to $10 000 per 7 day period up to $20 000 per 30 day period there is no dollar limit on how much you can receive via interac e transfer® to your eq bank account so long as you don t hit your maximum balance limit. to view the dollar limits associated with your account click here.

para_original_question.original_question: how do i deposit funds into my savings plus account
para_original_question.question: how can I deposit funds into my savings account plus
para_original_question.answer: there are three ways to deposit funds into your eq bank account via interac e transfer® via electronic funds transfer eft through your linked accounts via mobile cheque deposit through the eq bank mobile app interac e transfer® you can instantly deposit funds by sending an interac e transfer® to yourself using your other bank account. funds sent through this method are generally not subject to holds and funds are immediately available for use. note while it s free to send or receive interac e transfers® with eq bank your other bank may charge a fee for sending them. banks also tend to set daily limits on how much money you can send through interac e transfer® so it s best to use this method for smaller amounts generally $3 000 or less . electronic funds transfer eft using either the eq bank mobile app or through online banking you can deposit up to $100 000 per transaction from your linked account to your eq bank account. you can make multiple transactions per day. a hold period will apply to the deposited funds however you will start earning interest immediately. mobile cheque deposit using the eq bank mobile app you can deposit up to $100 000 per cheque. you can deposit multiple cheques per day. a hold period will apply to the deposited funds however you will start earning interest immediately. generally we hold funds deposited by cheque or electronic funds transfer eft for five business days beginning after the date of deposit. this means that funds held will actually become available by the sixth business day when you include the date of deposit. for example if you make a deposit on a monday you can access the funds on the following tuesday. although the deposit will be reflected in your account balance immediately you will not be able to withdraw or transfer the funds until the hold period has passed. during the hold period you continue to earn interest on the deposit amount. for more information please to refer to our hold funds policy. to view the dollar limits of other transaction types click here.

para_original_question.original_question: how do i withdraw funds from my savings plus account
para_original_question.question: How can I withdraw funds from my savings account more
para_original_question.answer: there are two ways to withdraw funds from your eq bank account via interac e transfer® via electronic funds transfer eft to your linked accounts interac e transfer® you can instantly withdraw funds by sending a free interac e transfer® to yourself from your eq bank account to your linked bank account. funds sent through this method are generally not subject to holds and funds are immediately available for use. note banks may set daily limits on how much money you can receive through interac e transfer® so it s best to use this method for smaller amounts. electronic funds transfer eft using the eq bank mobile app or through online banking you can transfer up to $30 000 per transaction from your eq bank account to your linked bank accounts. you can make multiple transactions per day. funds will take one to two business days to appear in your linked bank account.

para_original_question.question: if im move money from my eq bank account to my linked bank account how long it will take for the money to arrive

para_original_question.original_question: what happens if i dont sign in to my account for a while are there any dormant account fees
para_original_question.question: what happens if I don't connect to my account for a while is there a sleeping account charge
para_original_question.answer: your account will be considered dormant if there has been no activity for a 12 month period. if your account is dormant and has no balance it will be closed without notice. if your account is dormant and the balance is greater than $0 we will email you a dormant account notice. eq bank does not charge dormant account fees. for more information on dormant accounts please review our savings plus account agreement under the section titled dormant accounts.

para_original_question.original_question: who can i refer to open an eq bank account
para_original_question.question: which can refer me to open a bank account eq
para_original_question.answer: you can refer friends and family who aren t currently an eq bank customer and haven t already started the account sign up process.

para_original_question.original_question: how do i make a referral
para_original_question.question: How can I make a reference?
para_original_question.answer: sign in to your eq bank account and click on refer a friend to find your unique referral link. in order to qualify for a referral bonus the recipient of the referral must use your unique link to open their eq bank account and deposit at least $100 within 30 days of opening their account.

para_original_question.original_question: can i refer someone i want to open a joint savings account with
para_original_question.question: Can I send back someone I want to open a common savings account with
para_original_question.answer: if your friend or family member is not yet an eq bank customer they can sign up for an eq bank account using your unique referral link. once they ve opened their account you can send them an invite to create a joint account. unfortunately if the referral signed up using the link from the joint account invitation they don t qualify as a referral.

para_original_question.original_question: my friend is already an eq bank customer but i was the one who told them about eq bank can i still get a referral bonus
para_original_question.question: my friend is already a client eq bank, but I was the one who told them about eq bank can I always get a reference bonus
para_original_question.answer: no in order to qualify for the refer a friend program your friend must have signed up using your unique referral link and deposited a minimum of $100 into their account within 30 days.

para_original_question.original_question: what do i need to do to qualify for the referral bonus
para_original_question.question: what do I need to do to qualify for the referral bonus?
para_original_question.answer: if you re already a customer you can sign in to your eq bank account and click on refer a friend to find your unique referral link. the referral must use your unique link to open their eq bank account and make a deposit of at least $100 within 30 days in order to qualify for the referral bonus. once the referral has funded their account the bonus will be credited to your account typically by the next business day. if you re a new customer please ensure you sign up through the correct referral link in order to qualify for the referral bonus. you must deposit a minimum of $100 into your account within 30 days and the bonus will be credited to your account typically by the next business day.

para_original_question.original_question: how will i receive my referral bonus
para_original_question.question: how will I receive my reference bonus
para_original_question.answer: your referral bonus will be paid after the qualifying deposit has been completed. it will be deposited directly into your account typically by the next business day.

para_original_question.original_question: how long is my referral link valid for
para_original_question.question: how long is my reference link valid for
para_original_question.answer: your unique referral link doesn t expire. however in order for both individuals to receive the referral bonus the new customer must make a deposit of at least $100 within the first 30 days of opening their account.

para_original_question.original_question: if i was referred by more than one person can i qualify for more than one referral bonus
para_original_question.question: if I have been referred by more than one person, I may be eligible for more than one referral premium
para_original_question.answer: you can only accept one referral offer by signing up through that person s unique referral link.

para_original_question.original_question: how can i confirm if i have received my referral bonus
para_original_question.question: how do I confirm that I have received my reference bonus?
para_original_question.answer: your referral bonus will be paid after the qualifying deposit has been completed. it will be deposited directly into your account typically by the next business day. as the referrer you can view the status of your sent invitations from your account dashboard in progress means the referral has yet to open an eq bank account or complete the $100 minimum deposit. completed means the referral was successful and the referral bonus has been credited. expired means the referral signed up for an eq bank account but did not complete the $100 minimum deposit within 30 days. for every successful referral who signs up with your unique link and deposits a minimum of $100 into their account within 30 days you can earn 20 for the first three referrals $30 for the next four referrals $40 for any subsequent referrals up to a maximum $500 cap regardless of which earning tier you re in the new customer will receive a $20 referral bonus upon funding their account. to view the full terms and conditions click here.

para_original_question.original_question: i opened a savings plus account without using my friends referral invitation can i still get my bonus
para_original_question.question: I opened a savings account more without using my friends' reference invitation can still get my bonus
para_original_question.answer: unfortunately no. the referral bonus is only applicable for accounts opened using a unique referral link. to view our full terms and conditions click here.

para_original_question.original_question: whats a tfsa
para_original_question.question: What is a tfsa
para_original_question.answer: a tax free savings account tfsa is a registered investment or savings account that allows for tax free gains. a tfsa can be used for any savings goal and withdrawals can be made at any time during the year tax free. the amount of money that can be contributed to a tfsa is limited each year.

para_original_question.original_question: who can open an eq bank tfsa
para_original_question.question: which can open a bank eq tfsa
para_original_question.answer: any eq bank customer who has reached the age or majority in their province of residence and who has a valid social insurance number sin can open an eq bank tfsa. exceptions non canadian residents quebec residents customers with temporary sins

para_original_question.original_question: how do i open a tfsa
para_original_question.question: How to open a tfsa
para_original_question.answer: if you re not yet an eq bank customer you ll need to open a savings plus account first by visiting www.eqbank.ca and applying online. once you ve successfully opened your savings plus account follow the steps below to open your eq bank tfsa. for existing customers using a web browser sign in and click products select open a tfsa plan review details and submit your application using the mobile app sign in and tap the hamburger menu at the top right of your screen select open a new account plan tap open a tfsa plan review details and submit your application that s it

para_original_question.original_question: how much can i contribute to a tfsa per year
para_original_question.question: how much can I contribute to one tfsa per year
para_original_question.answer: the annual tfsa dollar limit for the year 2020 is $6 000 for all tfsas held in your name across all financial institutions. the tfsa annual contribution room limit will be indexed to inflation and rounded to the nearest $500. investment income earned by and changes in the value of your tfsa investments will not affect your tfsa contribution room for current or future years. in general tfsa contribution room is made up of the total of all of the following your tfsa dollar limit any unused tfsa contribution room from previous years any withdrawals made from the tfsa in the previous year an individual will not accumulate tfsa contribution room for any year during which the individual is a non resident of canada throughout the entire year. the tfsa dollar limit is not prorated in the year when an individual does any of one of the following turns 18 years of age dies becomes a resident or a non resident of canada

para_original_question.original_question: whats my contribution room for a tfsa each year
para_original_question.question: what is my contribution place for a tfsa every year
para_original_question.answer: in general the table below outlines your tfsa contribution limits for all tfsas held in your name across all financial institutions. tfsa contribution limits for all tfsas held in your name across all financial institutions year annual contribution limit tfsa cumulative limit 2020 $6 000 $69 500 2019 $6 000 $63 500 2018 $5 500 $57 500 2017 $5 500 $52 000 2016 $5 500 $46 500 2015 $10 000 $41 000 2014 $5 500 $31 000 2013 $5 500 $25 500 2012 $5 000 $20 000 2011 $5 000 $15 000 2010 $5 000 $10 000 2009 $5 000 $5000 you re responsible for tracking your contribution amounts each year. keep your eyes on your tfsas across all institutions so you don t accidentally over contribute

para_original_question.original_question: are tfsa contributions tax deductible
para_original_question.question: are deductible from tax on contributions
para_original_question.answer: contributions to a tfsa are not deductible for income tax purposes. any amount contributed as well as any income earned in the account for example interest earned in an eq bank tfsa savings account or tfsa gic is generally tax free even when it is withdrawn.

para_original_question.original_question: if i dont contribute to a tfsa can i use my unused contribution room in the future
para_original_question.question: If I don't contribute to a Tfsa, I can use my unused contribution coin in the future.
para_original_question.answer: if you withdraw from your tfsa you don t lose your contribution room. you can recontribute amounts you ve withdrawn on or after january 1 of the following year or years and your contribution room carries forward indefinitely.

para_original_question.original_question: do i need to have a particular income level to take advantage of a tfsa
para_original_question.question: to have a particular income level to enjoy a Tfsa
para_original_question.answer: tfsas are accessible to anyone so long as they meet the eligibility requirements but there are no minimum or maximum income levels. every eligible person accumulates contribution room annually starting from 2009.

para_original_question.original_question: if i didnt open a tfsa in 2009 do i still accumulate contribution room
para_original_question.question: if I did not open a Tfsa in 2009 I continue to accumulate contribution fees
para_original_question.answer: assuming you were at least 18 years old in 2009 yes. as of 2020 for example the tfsa cumulative limit if you ve never contributed is $69 500. this number grows every year subject to the annual tfsa contribution limit set by the federal government.

para_original_question.original_question: what happens if i contribute more than my contribution amount to a tfsa
para_original_question.question: what happens if I contribute more than my contribution to a Tfsa
para_original_question.answer: if you exceed your tfsa contribution limit for the year the canada revenue agency will charge a tax on the excess at 1 percentage per month. the tax is calculated based on the highest excess amount for the month and unlike rsps there s no $2 000 grace amount. you re responsible for tracking your contribution amounts each year. keep your eyes on your tfsas across all institutions so you don t accidentally over contribute

para_original_question.original_question: do i have to pay tax when i withdraw from my tfsa
para_original_question.question: I have to pay the tax when I withdraw from my tfsa
para_original_question.answer: thank the government for putting the tf in tfsa. so in other words no. withdrawals are completely tax free and your contribution limits reset every january 1.

para_original_question.answer: no we believe you should be able to move your money without penalties. should you wish to close your eq bank tfsa please call the eq bank customer care team at 1 844 437 2265 844 4eq bank .

para_original_question.question: refund by eq bank the transfer fees charged by my other financial institution to transfer my account
para_original_question.answer: unfortunately no we don t reimburse the transfer fees charged by other financial institutions.

para_original_question.original_question: will i receive a tax slip for my eq bank tfsa
para_original_question.question: Will I receive a tax slip for my bank eq tfsa
para_original_question.answer: no need contributions aren t tax deductible and withdrawals are tax free. in addition the interest earned within your tfsa is you guessed it tax free.

para_original_question.answer: one tfsa savings account per customer. dollars

para_original_question.original_question: how much can i deposit into my eq bank tfsa
para_original_question.question: how much can I deposit in my bank eq tfsa
para_original_question.answer: your plan can hold up $200 000 in funds combining your eq bank tfsa savings account and your tfsa gics. be sure to keep track of your contribution limit. visit our fees and amp features page for more details.

para_original_question.original_question: how do i withdraw funds from my tfsa
para_original_question.question: how can I withdraw funds from my tfsa
para_original_question.answer: using the eq bank mobile app or through online banking you can withdraw funds from your tfsa and move it to your savings plus account joint savings plus account linked accounts via electronic funds transfer eft note you can only perform current dated withdrawals from your tfsa and cannot set up recurring withdrawals.

para_original_question.original_question: how do i buy a tfsa gic
para_original_question.question: How can I buy a tfsa gic
para_original_question.answer: once you ve opened a tfsa savings account you can purchase a tfsa gic. once your tfsa gic reaches the maturity date the funds and interest earned will be deposited in your eq bank tfsa savings account. you ll receive an email or sms alert notifying you of the tfsa gic maturity. you can then choose to use the funds to purchase another eq bank tfsa gic or keep the money in your tfsa savings account.

para_original_question.original_question: is there a limit on how many eq bank tfsa gics i can purchase
para_original_question.question: Is there a limit on the number of eq bank tfsa gics I can buy
para_original_question.answer: there are no limits on how many eq bank tfsa gics you can buy but the total funds held across your tfsa savings account and tfsa gics cannot exceed $200 000. keep an eye on your contribution limits so you re not penalized for over contributing.

para_original_question.original_question: whats the difference between an rsp and an rrsp
para_original_question.question: What is the difference between a rsp and a rrsp
para_original_question.answer: rsp is an acronym for retirement savings plan. it can refer to any number of financial products designed to help you save for retirement. an rrsp which stands for registered retirement savings plan is a type of rsp with specific tax advantages contributions can be deducted from your income earnings on savings held within an rrsp aren t taxed until you withdraw funds while an rsp can refer to many types of accounts an rrsp refers to one type of account specifically. an rrsp is probably the best known rsp which is why you ll sometimes hear the terms used interchangeably. your eq bank rsp becomes registered once you add money to your account which means you get the tax advantages of an rrsp.

para_original_question.original_question: what are the benefits of an rsp
para_original_question.question: what are the benefits of a rsp
para_original_question.answer: any money you contribute to an rsp is tax deductible meaning the amount you contribute can be deducted from your income which means you pay less in income taxes. in addition the income you earn within your rsp is tax free. you will have to pay income taxes when you withdraw from your rsp. typically you ll withdraw funds from an rsp in retirement when you ll likely be in a lower tax bracket as opposed to withdrawing during your peak earning years.

para_original_question.original_question: what types of rsps does eq bank offer
para_original_question.question: that the types of rsps offers eq bank
para_original_question.answer: the eq bank rsp offers two types of investment products rsp savings account and rsp gic. when you open and deposit funds into an rsp savings account you can then choose to buy an rsp gic. once your rsp gic reaches maturity your principal and earned interest will be deposited back into your rsp savings account.

para_original_question.original_question: who can open an eq bank rsp
para_original_question.question: which can open a bank eq rsp
para_original_question.answer: an eq bank customer who has reached the age of majority in their province of residence and who has a valid social insurance number sin can open an eq bank rsp. exceptions customers turning 71 in the year of application non canadian residents quebec residents customers with temporary sins

para_original_question.original_question: how do i open an rsp savings account
para_original_question.question: how to open a rsp savings account
para_original_question.answer: if you re not yet an eq bank customer you ll need to open a savings plus account first by visiting www.eqbank.ca and applying online. once you ve successfully opened your savings plus account follow the steps below to open your eq bank rsp. for existing customers using a web browser sign in and click products select open a rsp plan review details and submit your application using the mobile app sign in and tap the hamburger menu at the top right of your screen select open a new account plan tap open a rsp plan review details and submit your application it s that simple.

para_original_question.original_question: how do i transfer an rsp from another financial institution to eq bank
para_original_question.question: How do I transfer an amount from another financial institution to an eq banking
para_original_question.answer: you can transfer an existing rsp from another institution to eq bank by following the steps below. using a web browser sign in and click products in the top navigation select transfer rsp from other bank select let s get started provide and confirm transfer details upload a signed transfer form this step can be completed at a later stage using the mobile app sign in and scroll to select rsp plan select transfer rsp from other bank select let s get started provide and confirm transfer details upload a signed transfer form this step can be completed at a later stage note your transfer form can also be mailed or faxed. the transfer process can take up to 6 8 weeks depending how quickly your other financial institution treats your request. you can check the status of your request from your account dashboard. dollars

para_original_question.original_question: how do i submit the signed rsp transfer form if i decided to skip that step previously
para_original_question.question: how do I submit the signed rsp transfer form if I decided to skip this step previously
para_original_question.answer: no problem. you can submit your signed transfer form by following the steps below. using a web browser sign in and select rsp plan select rsp savings account then check rsp transfer status select the correct transfer select submit signed transfer form you can download the form again or submit your signed form click upload signed transfer form using the mobile app sign in and scroll to select rsp plan select rsp savings account then check rsp transfer status select the correct transfer select submit signed transfer form you can download the form again or submit your signed form tap upload signed transfer form note your transfer form can also be mailed or faxed. the transfer process can take up to 6 8 weeks depending on the speed at which the other financial institution treats your request. you can track the status your request from your account dashboard. dollars

para_original_question.original_question: i mailed faxed my transfer form—how do i know if its been received
para_original_question.question: i mailed by fax my transfer form - how to find out if it was received
para_original_question.answer: once received your status will be updated and can be viewed from your account dashboard. upon receipt it could take up to 3 days before your status is updated. dollars

para_original_question.original_question: how do i buy an eq bank rsp gic
para_original_question.question: How can I buy a bank eq rsp gic
para_original_question.answer: once you ve opened an rsp savings account you can purchase an rsp gic. once your rsp gic reaches the maturity date the funds and interest earned will be deposited in your rsp savings account. you ll receive an email or sms alert notifying you of the rsp gic maturity. from there you can use the funds to purchase another rsp gic or keep the money in your rsp savings account.

para_original_question.original_question: how do i determine my rsp contribution limit
para_original_question.question: how to determine my contribution limit
para_original_question.answer: if you haven t already contributed to an rsp at another financial institution generally speaking your allowable rsp contribution for the current year is the lowest amount of the following 18 percentage of your earned income from the previous tax year. for most people earned income for rsp purposes is the amount in box 14 of their t4 slips. earning income also includes self employed net income cpp qpp disability payments and net rental income or the maximum annual contribution limit for the taxation year minus any company sponsored pension plan contributions defined as pa or short for pension adjustment on your t4 slip. a pa represents the value of any pension benefits accruing from participation in a registered pension plan or deferred profit sharing plan you re responsible for tracking your contribution amounts each year across all financial institutions in which you hold an rsp.

para_original_question.original_question: who can contribute to an eq bank rsp
para_original_question.question: which can contribute to a bank eq rsp
para_original_question.answer: anyone who has earned income has a social insurance number sin has attained the age of majority in their province and has filed a tax return can contribute to an eq bank rsp up until december 31 of the year they turn 71. once you turn 71 your eq bank rsp proceeds can either be withdrawn from the plan transferred to a registered retirement income fund rrif with another institution.

para_original_question.original_question: how do i withdraw from my rsp
para_original_question.question: How can I withdraw from my Rsp
para_original_question.answer: rsps are intended to provide a source of income in retirement so you re penalized with significant withholding taxes by the canada revenue agency if you withdraw the funds before you retire. while the money you contribute to the rsp is technically yours your bank will take between 10 percentage and 31 percentage in withholding tax right off the top and turn it over to the government the more you withdraw the higher the percentage. once that money is withdrawn you ve permanently lost that contribution room in your account. there are a few exceptions such as the home buyers plan hbp and lifelong learning plan llp which allow you to borrow a certain amount from your rsp tax free to help pay for your first home or cost of full time post secondary education. in these cases you essentially borrow money from yourself and you have to pay back the sum within a set amount of time. should you wish to withdraw funds from your eq bank rsp for any reason please call the eq bank customer care team at 1 844 437 2265 844 4eq bank . eq bank will deposit your rsp funds into your individual or joint savings plus account only.

para_original_question.original_question: how does the home buyers plan work
para_original_question.question: how the home purchase plan works
para_original_question.answer: the home buyers plan hbp is a program that allows you to withdraw funds from your rsp to buy or build a qualifying home for yourself or for a related person with a disability. the hbp allows you to pay back the withdrawn funds within a 15 year period. should you wish to withdraw funds from your eq bank rsp under the home buyers plan please call the eq bank customer care team at 1 844 437 2265 844 4eq bank .

para_original_question.original_question: how does the lifelong learning plan work
para_original_question.question: how the Lifelong Learning Plan works
para_original_question.answer: the lifelong learning plan llp is a program that allows you to withdraw up to $10 000 in a calendar year from your rsp to finance full time training or education for you your spouse or common law partner. as long as you meet the llp conditions every year you can withdraw from your rsp until january of the fourth calendar year after the year you made your first llp withdrawal. you cannot withdraw more than $20 000 in total. should you wish to withdraw funds from your eq bank rsp under the lifelong learning plan please call the eq bank customer care team at 1 844 437 2265 844 4eq bank .

para_original_question.original_question: when does an rsp mature
para_original_question.question: when a rsp matures
para_original_question.answer: an rsp must mature by the end of the year in which the annuitant turns 71 years of age. for an eq bank rsp plan we will contact customers in january of the year they turn 71 to confirm what they wish to do with the proceeds. options are withdraw from the plan transfer to a registered retirement income fund rrif with an issuing institution dollars

para_original_question.original_question: how do i designate a beneficiary on my eq bank rsp or tfsa
para_original_question.question: How do I designate a beneficiary on my bank eq rsp or tfsa
para_original_question.answer: you can designate up to five beneficiaries and choose the percentage that should be allocated to them upon your death. in the event the percentage entitlement s for your beneficiaries do not add up to 100 percentage the remaining portion will be paid to your estate. to designate a beneficiary you ll need to sign in to your eq bank account and download the beneficiary designation form.

para_original_question.original_question: what information do i need to designate a beneficiary
para_original_question.question: what information do I need to designate a beneficiary?
para_original_question.answer: to designate a beneficiary you ll need to sign in and download the beneficiary designation form for your eq bank rsp. you ll need to mail or fax it back to eq bank with the following information legal first and last name date of birth social insurance number sin mailing address relationship to the account holder

para_original_question.original_question: how will i receive my tax slips for my eq bank rsp
para_original_question.question: how will I receive my tax slips for my bank eq rsp
para_original_question.answer: tax slips such as the rsp contribution receipt or t4rsp can be downloaded as pdfs by signing in to your account through the eq bank mobile app or web browser. you can find the dates of when these documents will be available for download here. actual or deemed withdrawals from an rsp will be reported on a t4rsp slip. you won t be issued a t4rsp slip unless you ve made withdrawals from your eq bank rsp. eq bank will issue two contribution receipts which will allow you to claim the appropriate deductions to your taxable income your 2020 contribution receipt which states the contributions made in the last 10 months of 2020 your 2021 contribution receipt which states the contributions made for the first 60 days of 2021 you can always access the archive of your past tax documents by signing in to your eq bank account. new documents will be added as they become available.

para_original_question.original_question: is there a fee to transfer my eq bank rsp to another financial institution
para_original_question.question: Is there a fee to transfer my eq banking rsp to another financial institution
para_original_question.answer: no we believe you should be able to move your money without penalties. should you wish to close your eq bank rsp please call the eq bank customer care team at 1 844 437 2265 844 4eq bank .

para_original_question.original_question: how much can i deposit into an rsp savings account
para_original_question.question: how much I can deposit in a rsp savings account
para_original_question.answer: an eq bank rsp can hold up to $1 million combining your rsp savings account and your rsp gics. be sure to keep track of your contribution limit. visit our fees and amp features page for more details.

para_original_question.original_question: how many rsp accounts can i hold
para_original_question.question: how many rsp accounts I can keep
para_original_question.answer: you can hold one eq bank rsp account. dollars

para_original_question.original_question: how do i contribute to my rsp
para_original_question.question: how can I contribute to my rsp
para_original_question.answer: whether through your desktop or eq bank mobile app you can make rsp contributions directly from your savings plus account by following the steps below. using a web browser sign in and from your rsp dashboard click add money select the account you want the funds to come from select your rsp savings account as the destination select an amount deposit date and frequency and click next review your details and click submit using the mobile app sign in and from your dashboard scroll to select rsp plan from the rsp plan dashboard select rsp savings account from the bottom right expendable menu select add money select the account you want the funds to come from select your rsp savings account as the destination select an amount deposit date and frequency and click next review your details and tap submit

para_original_question.original_question: can i set up recurring automatic contributions to an rsp
para_original_question.question: can i configure recurring automatic contributions to a rsp
para_original_question.answer: yes this is a great way to keep on top of your contributions. follow the same steps for making an rsp contribution. when prompted choose the desired frequency of your recurring payment. you can easily change the frequency or cancel your recurring transfers from your desktop or mobile app.

para_original_question.original_question: can more than two people share a joint account
para_original_question.question: more than two people can share a common account
para_original_question.answer: yes you can share your joint account with three other co holders for a total of four account holders.

para_original_question.original_question: who can deposit and withdraw from the joint account
para_original_question.question: which can deposit and withdraw from the common account
para_original_question.answer: all co holders can make deposits pay bills and withdraw funds and all co holders can view account activity.

para_original_question.original_question: how do i open a joint account
para_original_question.question: how to open a joint account
para_original_question.answer: if you already have an eq bank account adding a joint account takes minutes. if you re not yet a customer opening an account is really easy and can be done by visiting www.eqbank.ca and applying online. for current customers we recommend keeping your existing individual savings plus account and opening a net new joint account but you can convert your existing account into a joint account. to open a new joint account sign in to online banking using a web browser click products at the top of your screen under savings plus account click open account and select the joint option state how you intend to use the account assign it a nickname and click next invite up to three co holders if a co holder is an existing eq bank customer use the email address associated with their eq bank account once your invitation is sent your co holder s will need to accept the invitation before the joint account process is complete review your invitation details and click submit that s it from your account details page you can see which invites are pending and which have been accepted. to convert an existing individual savings plus account to a joint account sign in to online banking select the account you wish to convert click more options in the upper right corner select convert to joint account state how you intend to use the account assign it a nickname and click next invite up to three co holders if a co holder is an existing eq bank customer use the email address associated with their eq bank account once your invitation is sent your co holder s will need to accept the invitation before the joint account process is complete review your invitation details and click submit from your account details page you can see which invites are pending and which have been accepted. your account will automatically convert to a joint account once a co holder has accepted your invitation.

para_original_question.original_question: can i share a joint account with someone whos not a canadian resident
para_original_question.question: Can I share a joint account with someone who is not a Canadian resident
para_original_question.answer: unfortunately not. all joint account holders must be canadian residents excluding quebec .

para_original_question.original_question: does a co holder need to be an existing eq bank customer
para_original_question.question: Does a co-owner need to be an existing bank eq client?
para_original_question.answer: you can invite anyone you want roommates best friends romantic partners even your mom and dad as long as they re a canadian resident excluding quebec and have reached the age of majority in their province. if you invite someone who is not an eq bank customer they ll need to sign up in order to accept your invitation. the good news is the invite explains the simple three step process to become a joint account co holder. or they can open an account by visiting www.eqbank.ca and applying online. either way to accept your invite they must sign up with the email address you provided in your invitation.

para_original_question.original_question: how do i know if a co holder has accepted my invitation
para_original_question.question: how to know if a co-owner has accepted my invitation
para_original_question.answer: to check the status of an invitation sign in to your eq bank account and select the account from which you sent the invite. from the account co holders section you can view the status of your invitations. an active status means the co holder has successfully accepted your invitation. a pending status means the co holder has not yet accepted your invitation. a failed status means the co holder has failed to answer the security question correctly. if you want to continue the joint account process with this co holder you ll need to resend your invitation.

para_original_question.original_question: what if a co holder hasnt received my invitation
para_original_question.question: What to do if a co-owner has received my invitation
para_original_question.answer: first check to see you have the correct email address. sign in to your eq bank account and select the joint account from which you sent the invite. you can resend an invitation from the account co holders section.

para_original_question.original_question: what if my co holders invitation expires
para_original_question.question: And if my invitation to co-owners expires
para_original_question.answer: your co holder s invitation is valid for a period of two weeks. if the invitation has expired simply sign in to your eq bank account and select the joint account from which you sent the invite. you can resend an invitation from the account co holders section.

para_original_question.original_question: can i have multiple joint accounts with different people
para_original_question.question: Can I have several common accounts with different people
para_original_question.answer: absolutely in addition to your main account you can open up to four other accounts for a total of five accounts. these can be all individual all joint or a mixture of both.

para_original_question.original_question: who claims the interest earned on their income taxes for a joint account
para_original_question.question: claiming interest earned on their income tax for a joint account
para_original_question.answer: a t5 tax slip will be issued in the name of the primary account holder and generated no later than february 28 of every year. all account co holders can get a copy of the t5 tax slip.

para_original_question.original_question: is there an account balance limit on a joint account
para_original_question.question: Is there a balance limit in a common account
para_original_question.answer: great question as an individual customer with a joint account you can have a maximum balance of up to $500 000 sum total across all your accounts.

para_original_question.original_question: how does cdic deposit insurance work for joint accounts
para_original_question.question: how cdic deposit insurance works for common accounts
para_original_question.answer: eligible joint deposits are protected for up to $100 000 per set of co holders not per co holder. eligible joint deposits are insured separately from individual savings plus account deposits. so for example you would be provided coverage for up to $100 000 in each of the following scenarios your individual savings account your joint savings account with a spouse your joint savings account with your parents you can read more about this on the cdic website.

para_original_question.original_question: can i change the primary account holder
para_original_question.question: Can I change the master account holder?
para_original_question.answer: the person who initiates the joint account is referred to as the primary account holder. we don t currently offer the option to change the primary account holder.

para_original_question.original_question: are joint account alerts different from my individual account alerts
para_original_question.question: are common account alerts different from my individual account alerts
para_original_question.answer: if you re the primary account holder of a joint account there are no differences. however if you re not the primary account holder of a joint account the following differences currently apply to alerts for your joint account all settings including dollar values of alerts are preset and cannot be adjusted at this time alerts are sent via email only and may take up to two days after a transaction is complete alerts will not be sent for unsuccessful recurring transactions

para_original_question.original_question: im not the primary account holder so why do my joint account alerts behave differently
para_original_question.question: is not the primary account holder so why my joint account alerts behave differently
para_original_question.answer: this is a snag that our team is working hard to resolve. rest assured these differences are temporary and we‘re working to provide real time adjustable alerts via your preferred platform text message or email .

para_original_question.original_question: how do i know if im the primary account holder of my joint account
para_original_question.question: How do I know if the principal holder of my joint account
para_original_question.answer: sign in to your eq bank account and go to your joint account details page. from the account co holders section you ll see a primary label beside the primary account holder s name.

para_original_question.original_question: how do i remove myself from a joint account
para_original_question.question: How do I withdraw from a common account
para_original_question.answer: unfortunately we can t remove an account holder from a joint account but we can close the account for you. to close your account please call the eq bank customer care team at 1 844 437 2265 844 4eq bank or launch live chat and we ll help you out.

para_original_question.original_question: do all account holders need to give permission to close a joint account
para_original_question.question: all account holders must give permission to close a joint account
para_original_question.answer: no they don t. one account holder can close the joint account as long as the account has a zero balance. to close your account please call the eq bank customer care team at 1 844 437 2265 844 4eq bank or launch live chat and we ll help you out. if however the joint account is your only account with eq bank we ll reach out to you to confirm you wish to close it as doing so will terminate your relationship with eq bank.

para_original_question.original_question: what happens if a joint account holder passes away
para_original_question.question: what happens in the event of the death of a joint account holder
para_original_question.answer: should a joint account holder pass away please immediately call the eq bank customer care team at 1 844 437 2265 844 4eq bank . we ll do everything we can to help.

para_original_question.original_question: what is transferwise
para_original_question.question: what is transferred
para_original_question.answer: transferwise is a service that offers a cheap fast way to send money around the world. transferwise was founded in 2011 is registered with multiple financial authorities around the globe and has served over 6 million people in 71 countries. transferwise canada inc. is registered with the financial transactions and reports analysis centre of canada fintrac as a money service business msb with registration number m15193392. they also hold a msb licence with the authorité des marchés financiers amf under licence number 902804.

para_original_question.original_question: what is the relationship between eq bank and transferwise
para_original_question.question: What is the relationship between eq bank and transfer
para_original_question.answer: eq bank and transferwise have formed a partnership that allows customers to send cheap and fast international money transfers directly from their eq bank account through online banking or the mobile app.

para_original_question.original_question: if i send an international money transfer how will i know my money is safe
para_original_question.question: if I send an international money transfer how I know my money is safe
para_original_question.answer: international money transfers sent using the savings plus account are powered by transferwise which uses https encryption and two factor authentication to protect all transactions and make sure all communications are secure. dollars

para_original_question.original_question: what is the real exchange rate
para_original_question.question: what the real exchange rate is
para_original_question.answer: the real exchange rate is the mid point between the buy and sell rates on the global currency markets and it constantly fluctuates. it s the rate you ll find on reuters google yahoo finance etc. and it s also the rate you ll get when you send your international money transfer via transferwise.

para_original_question.original_question: how can i see the real exchange rate and the charge associated with an international money transfer
para_original_question.question: how do I see the real exchange rate and the burden associated with an international money transfer
para_original_question.answer: you can access our calculator here to see the current exchange rate as well as the transaction charge. dollars

para_original_question.original_question: can i use my existing transferwise account to send an international money transfer from eq bank what if i dont have a transferwise account
para_original_question.question: Can I use my existing transfer account to send an international transfer of money from the eq bank only if I do not have a transfer account
para_original_question.answer: the first time you send an international money transfer from eq bank you will be asked to sign in to your existing transferwise account. if you do not already have an account with transferwise you can set one up within the eq bank online banking site or mobile app. you ll only need to do this step once and subsequent international transfers will be even easier to send.

para_original_question.original_question: how much does it cost to send an international money transfer
para_original_question.question: how much it costs to send an international money transfer
para_original_question.answer: eq bank powered by transferwise converts money using the real exchange rate and charges a conversion fee based on the amount you re sending and the currency you ve selected. you can view the conversion fee before sending an international money transfer through your eq bank account or you can click here to calculate the conversion fee based on the currencies selected. dollars

para_original_question.original_question: can i cancel an international money transfer
para_original_question.question: Can I cancel an international money transfer?
para_original_question.answer: unfortunately you cannot cancel an international money transfer once the transaction has been submitted but you will have an opportunity to review the transaction details prior to clicking the submit button. dollars

para_original_question.original_question: can i cancel an international money transfer with a status of “pending”
para_original_question.question: Can I cancel an international money transfer with a status of "waiting"
para_original_question.answer: unfortunately you cannot recall or cancel an international money transfer once you ve reviewed the transaction details and clicked the submit button. dollars

para_original_question.original_question: how can i view my transaction history and check the status of my international money transfer
para_original_question.question: how can I see my transaction history and check the status of my international money transfer
para_original_question.answer: you can view the status of your international money transfer on the international transfer dashboard. to do so simply click transfers and choose send international transfer. this screen will contain your transaction history and will show your previous transactions as pending completed or bounce back which appears in the case of an error that results in the money being refunded into your account in its entirety . dollars

para_original_question.original_question: how long will it take for the international money transfer to be accessible to the recipient
para_original_question.question: How long will it take for the international transfer of money to be accessible to the recipient?
para_original_question.answer: the exact time period of an international money transfer depends on multiple factors including the destination country the time of day the transfer is sent and security checks. some recipients may receive their funds within 24 hours and all recipients should receive their funds within 3 business days.

para_original_question.original_question: will it take longer to process the first international money transfer i send versus subsequent international money transfers
para_original_question.question: Will it take more time to process the first international money transfer that I am sending in relation to subsequent international money transfers?
para_original_question.answer: great news it doesn t take longer to process an international money transfer if it s your first one it may take a few more minutes to complete your first transaction as you ll need to link your account to transferwise and fill out new recipient details but once you click submit on your transaction funds should be received within 3 business days. dollars

para_original_question.original_question: does the recipient of an international money transfer need a transferwise account to access their funds
para_original_question.question: Does the recipient of an international money transfer need a transfer account to access its funds?
para_original_question.answer: the recipient does not require a transferwise account to access their funds as they will receive the money directly in the bank account that was specified in the transaction.

para_original_question.original_question: can the recipient track the international money transfer while its in progress
para_original_question.question: can the recipient follow the international money transfer during its course
para_original_question.answer: unfortunately the recipient cannot track the progress of the international money transfer but you can check the status of the transaction on your international transfer dashboard and let the recipient know they should receive it within 3 business days.

para_original_question.original_question: my international money transfer wasnt received by the recipient what can i do
para_original_question.question: my international money transfer has not been received by the recipient what can I do
para_original_question.answer: check the status of your international money transfer. if the transfer has a status of pending it s still on its way to the recipient. if the transfer shows a status of completed the money has been delivered but it may not yet be available in the recipient s account. it can take some banks up to 1 additional business day to process and release the money. if the delay has exceeded the anticipated period of 3 business days you can check the transferwise id listed along with the other transaction details in the transaction history and call the eq bank customer care team for assistance. if the status of the transaction appears as bounce back the funds did not reach the recipient and the money will be refunded into your account in its entirety. note these funds will not earn interest during the period they are not in your eq bank savings plus account. dollars

para_original_question.original_question: can i send an international money transfer if i dont know my recipients bank details
para_original_question.question: Can I send an international money transfer if I don't know my bank details
para_original_question.answer: you will not be able to send an international money transfer without the recipient s bank details. in order to send the transfer you ll need to add a new recipient and fill in the banking details in the mandatory fields. dollars

summ_orig_answer.question: how long does eq bank hold my funds for
summ_orig_answer.answer: generally we hold funds deposited by cheque or electronic funds transfer eft for five business days beginning after the date of deposit.
summ_orig_answer.original_answer: generally we hold funds deposited by cheque or electronic funds transfer eft for five business days beginning after the date of deposit. this means that funds held will actually become available by the sixth business day when you include the date of deposit. for example if you make a deposit on a monday you can access the funds on the following tuesday. although the deposit is reflected immediately in your account balance you won t be able to withdraw or transfer your funds until the hold period has passed. however during the hold period you still earn interest on the deposit amount. for more details check out our hold funds policy.

000 per cheque. you can deposit multiple cheques per day. a hold period will apply to the deposited funds however you will start earning interest immediately. generally we hold funds deposited by cheque or electronic funds transfer eft for five business days beginning after the date of deposit. this means that funds held will actually become available by the sixth business day when you include the date of deposit. for example if you make a deposit on a monday you can access the funds on the following tuesday. although the deposit will be reflected in your account balance immediately you will not be able to withdraw or transfer the funds until the hold period has passed. during the hold period you continue to earn interest on the deposit amount. for more information please to refer to summ_orig_answer.question: whats the difference between an rsp and an rrsp
summ_orig_answer.answer: rsp is an acronym for retirement savings plan.
summ_orig_answer.original_answer: rsp is an acronym for retirement savings plan. it can refer to any number of financial products designed to help you save for retirement. an rrsp which stands for registered retirement savings plan is a type of rsp with specific tax advantages contributions can be deducted from your income earnings on savings held within an rrsp aren t taxed until you withdraw funds while an rsp can refer to many types of accounts an rrsp refers to one type of account specifically. an rrsp is probably the best known rsp which is why you ll sometimes hear the terms used interchangeably. your eq bank rsp becomes registered once you add money to your account which means you get the tax advantages of an rrsp.

summ_orig_answer.question: what are the benefits of an rsp
summ_orig_answer.answer: any money you contribute to an rsp is tax deductible meaning the amount you contribute can be deducted from your income which means you pay less in income taxes.
summ_orig_answer.original_answer: any money you contribute to an rsp is tax deductible meaning the amount you contribute can be deducted from your income which means you pay less in income taxes. in addition the income you earn within your rsp is tax free. you will have to pay income taxes when you withdraw from your rsp. typically you ll withdraw funds from an rsp in retirement when you ll likely be in a lower tax bracket as opposed to withdrawing during your peak earning years.

summ_orig_answer.question: how do i determine my rsp contribution limit
summ_orig_answer.answer: if you haven t already contributed to an rsp at another financial institution generally speaking your allowable rsp contribution for the current year is the lowest amount of the following 18 percentage of your earned income from the previous tax year.

summ_orig_answer.question: how do i withdraw from my rsp
summ_orig_answer.answer: rsps are intended to provide a source of income in retirement so you re penalized with significant withholding taxes by the canada revenue agency if you withdraw the funds before you retire.
summ_orig_answer.original_answer: rsps are intended to provide a source of income in retirement so you re penalized with significant withholding taxes by the canada revenue agency if you withdraw the funds before you retire. while the money you contribute to the rsp is technically yours your bank will take between 10 percentage and 31 percentage in withholding tax right off the top and turn it over to the government the more you withdraw the higher the percentage. once that money is withdrawn you ve permanently lost that contribution room in your account. there are a few exceptions such as the home buyers plan hbp and lifelong learning plan llp which allow you to borrow a certain amount from your rsp tax free to help pay for your first home or cost of full time post secondary education. in these cases you essentially borrow money from yourself and you have to pay back the sum within a set amount of time. should you wish to withdraw funds from your eq bank rsp for any reason please call the eq bank customer care team at 1 844 437 2265 844 4eq bank . eq bank will deposit your rsp funds into your individual or joint savings plus account only.

summ_orig_answer.question: how does the lifelong learning plan work

summ_orig_answer.question: how do i open a joint account
